required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study in Patients With High-risk Recurrent Primary Hepatocellular Carcinoma Using Autologous TILs
clinical_study.official_title: Early Clinical Trials on Evaluating the Tolerance, Safety and Efficacy of Autologous TILs in High-risk Recurrent Primary Hepatocellular Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: Early clinical trials on evaluating the tolerance, safety and efficacy of autologous TILs in high-risk recurrent primary hepatocellular carcinoma

primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the tolerability and safty of autologous TILs in high-risk recurrent primary hepatocellular carcinoma.
To evaluate the tolerability and safty of autologous TILs in high-risk recurrent primary hepatocellular carcinoma.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of autologous TILs in high-risk recurrent primary hepatocellular carcinoma.
To evaluate the efficacy of autologous TILs in high-risk recurrent primary hepatocellular carcinoma.

arm_group.description: The number of TIL is decided by dose escalation experiment.

intervention.description: Tumor infiltrating lymphocytes were isolated from tumor tissues from tumor biopsy or operation. These TILs were cultured in human IL-2 medium for 4 to 5 weeks. 10e9 to 10e10 TILs were yielded. The phenotype, function and sterile were detected before these TILs infused patients.
